name: Sheraton Bandara

reviews.text: I had stayed at the hotel about 7 years ago and remembered it as beautiful and pleasant, and an advantage is the location of the hotel near the airport. Now I returned for three nights and did not get the room I reserved (with furnished terrace), but a room on the first floor where windows cannot be opened. First that disturbed me, but then the advantage is that no mosquitoes come into the room. After the long journey from Europe I was just to tired to make a fuss shortly before midnight. There are also many airline crews residing at the hotel. To start with description of the hotel, the appearance is still very good, and the staff is as friendly and helpful without exception as it ever was. Unfortunately, the buildings are a bit run down and would deserve a touch up. Still, room utilities were all in good order, and something I always appreciate there was a coffee maker (coffee replenished regularly free of charge) and an ironing board in the room. Bottled and sealed mineral water of a reputed brand was also replenished regularly free of charge. Food (buffets) was good. A detail on the laundry service: Laundry delivered before 7 am should be returned same day at 20h, but I didn't receive my laundry. After a phone call at about 21 h I received it in five minutes. There is no service directory with phone numbers in the room, only the indication "guest services" on the phone. I regret I forgot my bathing trunks, as there is a nice swimming pool in the centre of the hotel. I did not have enough time to visit all other highlights of the hotel as I was on a business trip and not on holidays. A final positive point is that there is a reliable free shuttle service to the airport on demand. However on the other way form airport to hotel, I hadn’t found a shuttle service, and had to take a local taxi. The driver asked for 40 USD, but then accepted 5 USD which is still an very high price, if not excessive, for the short stretch of about 2 km.
reviews.title: An Airport Hotel that has some local charm

reviews.text: Coming through for 20 hours between planes at awkward times, not being charged for 2 days was an unexpected bonus. Not a sign of a mosquito and no smell of damp or dampness in the room I was given, which was upstairs and probably in a western wing. Just everything I needed. Including directions to get me to and from a place to pick up last minute purchases without missing the plane by sitting in a Jakarta mobile carpark masquerading as a freeway. I'm glad I didnt know it was a Starwood till I got there. It more than cured my promise to myself never to stay in one of their hotels again. If I have to overnight in Jakarta again I won't be staying anywhere else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were invited for the weekend to attend an event in Jakarta and accommodated at the Sheraton Bandara. It is very convenient and close to the airport (5 minutes drive) and we saw many airline crew members staying there. The hotel grounds are very nice but the bedrooms were something else. Ours had a musty smell and unfortunately, because the glass doors (we were on the ground floor) could not be opened, we could not freshen this up. My request to the reception to use some aromatherapy oils went unheeded. The bedsheets & towels supposedly white, were a greyish color. The sinks had mold. The floor were not clean and I picked up an old biscuit. I would not stay there again unless I had to leave for the airport on an early morning flight. I did not sleep well because the room felt so cold due to the tiled flooring, even though I adjusted the airconditioning.
reviews.title: Very convenient to airport but rooms are not clean

reviews.text: Whilst I avoided staying in this hotel after being bitten my mozzies during my stay in 2009, due to work and colleagues already staying at this hotel, I chose to stay here again, and hoped that it would be better than my last visit.

reviews.text: Surprisingly - minimal mosquitoes this time. Maybe it was the mosquitoe season in early 2009, however this time mozzies wasn't a problem.

reviews.text: In addition, I believe they must have got a new F&B manager, as breakfast and dinner buffet selections have improved in the selection, quantity and quality. For the month of April 2009, they had a limited Mexican selection (burittos, nachos etc.) during dinner, and on Friday, they introduced a Surf & Turf section as well - this being beef steaks, Australian wagyu beef, some salmon, biggish prawns. While somewhat better, there is still room for further improvement.
reviews.title: How can Sheraton leave it's name on this dump?

reviews.text: The sashimi spread was limited to some sushi and a couple of fresh sashimi selections.
reviews.title: Double booking of rooms is unacceptable

reviews.text: My wife, Indonesian, just had given birth to our daughter 9 days ago when we traveled back home to the Maldives where we live and do business. We choose the Sheraton by 2 reasons, the close proximity to the Jakarta airport (3 minutes by car) and lastly Sheraton was my home for more than 10 years working for them internationally.
reviews.title: A wonderful surprise!

reviews.text: Despite being so close to an international airport it felt like being in an oasis, right on a lake surrounded by green pure nature; don't expect the usual airport hotel setup! The property is laid out beautifully (which we saw only in the morning as we arrived very late in the evening) and is actually more a resort than an airport hotel. Having never been there and my reservation did not indicate to have been an "old family member" the staff of the hotel treated us very nice, had booked a junior suite and we were offered the Presidential Suit as an upgrade, as the suit was only ready in a little more than 30 minutes and having a 9 days old new born that needed a diapers change etc. we decided to stick to our junior suit, which was very fine, a well appointed room with all that one expects by booking a suit. Went for a late dinner to the restaurant and had a great meal at reasonable prices.
reviews.title: The smell woke me up at night

reviews.text: This property is ideal for stop over before a next flight to wind down and relax and enjoy; the Bandara will see us again in September when we will fly home again from our Ramadan holidays in Indonesia, that's for sure!
reviews.title: perfect for transit
